decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: Proposed Ground Floor Plan drawing no.150/03/200, Proposed First Floor Plan drawing no.150/03/201, Proposed Second Floor Plan drawing no.150/03/202, Proposed Roof Plan drawing no.150/03/203, Proposed Front Elevation drawing no.150/03/204, Proposed Rear Elevation drawing no.150/03/205_02, Proposed Side Elevation drawing no.150/03/206, Proposed Section A-A drawing no.150/03/207, Proposed Section B-B drawing no.150/03/208, Proposed Home Office plan drawing no.150/03/209 and Proposed Home Office Section  drawing no.150/03/211

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials shall be in accordance with the materials described in the Application Form and the Approved Plans as listed in Condition 2 of this decision.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policy 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policy D3 of the London Plan (2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 12.

| The proposed detached replacement rear outbuilding shall only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the development hereby approved, and shall not be used for habitable accommodation, as an independent dwelling or any industrial, commercial or business use.

REASON: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 & D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 12.
| No kitchen facilities shall be installed in the outbuilding at any time.

REASON: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the site and to ensure that the use of the building does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1,1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 12.
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

REASON: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
| Demolition Method Statement and Construction Management Plan Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays,
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan 2021 policy D13 the National Planning Policy Framework (2021 - sections 2 and 9 and Interim guidance Ealing's SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'
description: Single storey side/rear extension (following demolition of existing single storey rear/side extension) and outbuilding with lower ground (office)(following partial demolition of existing garage/outbuilding).
